meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>distressed</kanji> and <kanji>troubled</kanji>. The verb versions of those are <vocabulary>to be distressed</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to be troubled</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: If someone seems <vocabulary>to be distressed</vocabulary> maybe someone they know is in a <reading>coma</reading> (こま). Not too many things are more distressing and troubling than that.
